Conclusion: Summary of key learnings: You have learned the fundamentals of web development with Python using Flask and Django.
Next steps: Explore advanced topics such as testing, security, and performance optimization.
Further resources: Refer to the official Flask and Django documentation, online tutorials, and community forums.
Day 1: Module 1: Introduction to Web Development & Python - Overview of web development concepts, setting up a Python environment, and understanding HTTP.
Module 2: HTML Fundamentals - Learning basic HTML tags, creating simple pages, and understanding forms.
Module 3: CSS Fundamentals - Introduction to CSS styling, applying CSS to HTML, and understanding selectors and properties.
Day 2: Module 1: Introduction to Flask - Understanding the Flask framework, creating a simple application, and learning about routes and views.
Module 2: Flask Templates and Forms - Using Jinja2 templates, creating and handling HTML forms, and learning about form validation.
Module 3: Flask and Databases - Connecting to a database, performing CRUD operations, and using SQLAlchemy ORM.
Day 3: Module 1: Introduction to Django - Understanding the Django framework, creating a project and app, and learning about models, views, and templates.
Module 2: Django Models and Migrations - Defining models, creating and applying migrations, and understanding Django's ORM.
Module 3: Django Views and Templates - Creating views, using Django's template engine, and passing data from views to templates.
Day 4: Module 1: Django Forms - Creating and using Django forms, handling form submissions, and implementing form validation.
Module 2: Django Admin Interface - Understanding the admin interface, customizing it, and using it to manage data.
Module 3: REST APIs with Flask - Understanding REST API principles, creating APIs using Flask, and using Flask-RESTful.
Day 5: Module 1: REST APIs with Django REST Framework - Understanding Django REST Framework, creating APIs, and using serializers and viewsets.
Module 2: Authentication and Authorization - Implementing user authentication and authorization in Flask and Django, securing web applications.
Module 3: Deployment - Deploying Flask and Django applications to a cloud platform, configuring a web server, and understanding best practices.
Introduction: Course overview and objectives: Learn to build web applications using Python. This course covers fundamental web development concepts and frameworks.
Prerequisites: Basic Python knowledge is recommended. Familiarity with command line is helpful.
What you'll learn: You will learn to build dynamic web applications using Flask and Django, interact with databases, and create REST APIs.

YouTubeReferences.description: A fast-paced introduction to the Flask framework for building web applications in Python. Covers setting up a project, creating routes, rendering templates, and handling form data.
YouTubeReferences.title: Python Web Development: Flask Framework Crash Course

YouTubeReferences.description: A comprehensive tutorial covering the Django framework, including models, views, templates, URL routing, and database integration. Builds a complete web application from scratch.
YouTubeReferences.title: Django Tutorial for Beginners | Full Course

YouTubeReferences.description: Learn how to build RESTful APIs using Python and the Flask framework. Covers request handling, data serialization (JSON), authentication, and API design principles.
YouTubeReferences.title: REST APIs with Python and Flask: A Practical Guide

YouTubeReferences.description: An introduction to asynchronous programming in Python for web development. Covers the asyncio library and the aiohttp framework for building high-performance web applications.
YouTubeReferences.title: Asynchronous Web Development with Python: Asyncio and Aiohttp

YouTubeReferences.description: Learn how to extract data from websites using Python libraries like Beautiful Soup and Scrapy. Covers parsing HTML, handling pagination, and storing scraped data.
YouTubeReferences.title: Web Scraping with Python: Beautiful Soup and Scrapy

YouTubeReferences.description: Covers advanced Django topics such as caching, database optimization, deployment strategies, and using Celery for asynchronous tasks to build scalable web applications.
YouTubeReferences.title: Advanced Django: Building Scalable Web Applications
